page.title: 13MILTON MANOR ESTATE
page.content: In the North-east corner of the area is{Milton Manor Farm,}once part of the 600 year old Estate. The farm, beside the River Stour has pigs, sheep, bul- locks and 50 acres of Spring Barley, about 100 acres in all. The Manor House was demolished in 1959, but the church of St. John the Baptist still stands although services were sus- pended in 1980. Built in the 12th century, it was restored in 1829, with seating capacity for 52. When the church closed there were only 6 resi- dents at Milton. The living was part of Thanington and services were held 6 times a year. Access to the little flint church, with open bell cage, is via the Public Footpaths which run through the farm. The Robert Brett Group, local quarriers, who own the land, intend to preserve the church.
